trans-unit.source: Stampinf Properties for Driver Projects
trans-unit.target: Stampinf Properties for Driver Projects

trans-unit.source: Sets the properties for the [Stampinf](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/Library/Windows/Hardware/Ff552786) tool.
trans-unit.target: Sets the properties for the [Stampinf](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/Library/Windows/Hardware/Ff552786) tool.

trans-unit.source: You can use Stampinf to update common INF and INX file directives when you build the driver.
trans-unit.target: You can use Stampinf to update common INF and INX file directives when you build the driver.

trans-unit.source: Setting Stampinf properties for driver projects
trans-unit.target: Setting Stampinf properties for driver projects

trans-unit.source: Open the property pages for your driver project.
trans-unit.target: Open the property pages for your driver project.

trans-unit.source: Right-click the driver project in **Solution Explorer** and select **Properties**.
trans-unit.target: Right-click the driver project in **Solution Explorer** and select **Properties**.

trans-unit.source: In the property pages for the driver project, click **Configuration Properties** and then click **Stampinf**.
trans-unit.target: In the property pages for the driver project, click **Configuration Properties** and then click **Stampinf**.

trans-unit.source: Set the properties for the project.
trans-unit.target: Set the properties for the project.

trans-unit.source: If you want to add this property page to your project, so that you can run the Stampinf during the build process, see the [WDK and Visual Studio build environment](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/Library/Windows/Hardware/Hh454286) and the [Stampinf task](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/Library/Windows/Hardware/Ff552786_task).
trans-unit.target: If you want to add this property page to your project, so that you can run the Stampinf during the build process, see the [WDK and Visual Studio build environment](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/Library/Windows/Hardware/Hh454286) and the [Stampinf task](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/Library/Windows/Hardware/Ff552786_task).

trans-unit.source: Stampinf option
trans-unit.target: Stampinf option

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Enable Architecture
trans-unit.target: Enable Architecture

trans-unit.source: Enables the replacement of the $ARCH$ variable used in INX files.
trans-unit.target: Enables the replacement of the $ARCH$ variable used in INX files.

trans-unit.source: If enabled, the value specified for Architecture is used.
trans-unit.target: If enabled, the value specified for Architecture is used.

trans-unit.source: If No is specified, the $ARCH$ variable is removed.
trans-unit.target: If No is specified, the $ARCH$ variable is removed.

trans-unit.source: For example, "Standard.NT$ARCH$" becomes "Standard.NT".
trans-unit.target: For example, "Standard.NT$ARCH$" becomes "Standard.NT".

trans-unit.source: Architecture
trans-unit.target: Architecture

trans-unit.source: Specifies the architecture string to replace the $ARCH$ variable that is used in INX files.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the architecture string to replace the $ARCH$ variable that is used in INX files.

trans-unit.source: The default value is $(InfArch), a macro that selects the current active configuration in Visual Studio.
trans-unit.target: The default value is $(InfArch), a macro that selects the current active configuration in Visual Studio.

trans-unit.source: Possible values include x86, x64.
trans-unit.target: Possible values include x86, x64.

trans-unit.source: This setting is equivalent to specifying the Stampinf option -a [architecture].
trans-unit.target: This setting is equivalent to specifying the Stampinf option -a [architecture].

trans-unit.source: Enable VersionStamp
trans-unit.target: Enable VersionStamp

trans-unit.source: Enables the version time stamp.
trans-unit.target: Enables the version time stamp.

trans-unit.source: If enabled, the Driver Version Number must not be empty.
trans-unit.target: If enabled, the Driver Version Number must not be empty.

trans-unit.source: The Driver Version Number specifies the time that is written in the INF DriverVer directive for the version number.
trans-unit.target: The Driver Version Number specifies the time that is written in the INF DriverVer directive for the version number.

trans-unit.source: If not enabled, see the description of the default behavior for this option under Driver Version Number.
trans-unit.target: If not enabled, see the description of the default behavior for this option under Driver Version Number.

trans-unit.source: Driver Version Number
trans-unit.target: Driver Version Number

trans-unit.source: Specifies the time that is written in the INF DriverVer directive for the version number.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the time that is written in the INF DriverVer directive for the version number.

trans-unit.source: The format for the time is hours.minutes.seconds.milliseconds (for example, 11.30.20.15).
trans-unit.target: The format for the time is hours.minutes.seconds.milliseconds (for example, 11.30.20.15).

trans-unit.source: This option is useful during development because it provides a convenient way to increase the version number of the driver.
trans-unit.target: This option is useful during development because it provides a convenient way to increase the version number of the driver.

trans-unit.source: This setting is equivalent to specifying the Stampinf option -v [ time | *].
trans-unit.target: This setting is equivalent to specifying the Stampinf option -v [ time | *].

trans-unit.source: To use the current time, specify an asterisk (*) with this parameter.
trans-unit.target: To use the current time, specify an asterisk (*) with this parameter.

trans-unit.source: Default behavior:
trans-unit.target: Default behavior:

trans-unit.source: If the Driver Version Number is not specified, or if Enable VersionStamp is No or unspecified, Stampinf uses one of the following version number values:
trans-unit.target: If the Driver Version Number is not specified, or if Enable VersionStamp is No or unspecified, Stampinf uses one of the following version number values:

trans-unit.source: If the STAMPINF_VERSION environment variable is set, Stampinf uses the version number value that is specified by this environment variable.
trans-unit.target: If the STAMPINF_VERSION environment variable is set, Stampinf uses the version number value that is specified by this environment variable.

trans-unit.source: If the STAMPINF_VERSION environment variable is not specified, Stampinf extracts the version number from the ntverp.h file.
trans-unit.target: If the STAMPINF_VERSION environment variable is not specified, Stampinf extracts the version number from the ntverp.h file.

trans-unit.source: Note By default, the STAMPINF_VERSION environment variable is not set when you build a driver unless you set it as a system environment variable.
trans-unit.target: Note By default, the STAMPINF_VERSION environment variable is not set when you build a driver unless you set it as a system environment variable.

trans-unit.source: To specify this environment variable within the Visual Studio build environment, see How to: Use Environment Variables in a Build.
trans-unit.target: To specify this environment variable within the Visual Studio build environment, see How to: Use Environment Variables in a Build.

trans-unit.source: Enable DateStamp
trans-unit.target: Enable DateStamp

trans-unit.source: Enables the date stamp.
trans-unit.target: Enables the date stamp.

trans-unit.source: If enabled, the Driver Version Directive Date must not be empty.
trans-unit.target: If enabled, the Driver Version Directive Date must not be empty.

trans-unit.source: If not enabled, see the description of the default behavior for this option under Driver Version Directive Date.
trans-unit.target: If not enabled, see the description of the default behavior for this option under Driver Version Directive Date.

trans-unit.source: Driver Version Directive Date
trans-unit.target: Driver Version Directive Date

trans-unit.source: Specifies the date that is written in the INF DriverVer directive.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the date that is written in the INF DriverVer directive.

trans-unit.source: The format for the date is month/date/year (for example, 10/20/2011).
trans-unit.target: The format for the date is month/date/year (for example, 10/20/2011).

trans-unit.source: To use the current date, specify an asterisk (*) with this parameter.
trans-unit.target: To use the current date, specify an asterisk (*) with this parameter.

trans-unit.source: Default behavior:
trans-unit.target: Default behavior:

trans-unit.source: If the Driver Version Directive Date parameter is not specified, or if Enable DateStamp is No or unspecified, Stampinf uses one of the following date values:
trans-unit.target: If the Driver Version Directive Date parameter is not specified, or if Enable DateStamp is No or unspecified, Stampinf uses one of the following date values:

trans-unit.source: If the STAMPINF_DATE environment variable is set, Stampinf uses the date value that is specified by this environment variable.
trans-unit.target: If the STAMPINF_DATE environment variable is set, Stampinf uses the date value that is specified by this environment variable.

trans-unit.source: If the STAMPINF_DATE environment variable is not specified, Stampinf uses the current date.
trans-unit.target: If the STAMPINF_DATE environment variable is not specified, Stampinf uses the current date.

trans-unit.source: This setting is equivalent to specifying the Stampinf option -d [date|*].
trans-unit.target: This setting is equivalent to specifying the Stampinf option -d [date|*].

trans-unit.source: Note By default, the STAMPINF_DATE environment variable is not set when you build a driver unless you set it as a system environment variable.
trans-unit.target: Note By default, the STAMPINF_DATE environment variable is not set when you build a driver unless you set it as a system environment variable.

trans-unit.source: To specify this environment variable within the Visual Studio build environment, see How to: Use Environment Variables in a Build.
trans-unit.target: To specify this environment variable within the Visual Studio build environment, see How to: Use Environment Variables in a Build.

trans-unit.source: Driver Version Directive Section
trans-unit.target: Driver Version Directive Section

trans-unit.source: Specifies the INF section in which to put the INF DriverVer directive.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the INF section in which to put the INF DriverVer directive.

trans-unit.source: The default location for this directive is the INF Version section.
trans-unit.target: The default location for this directive is the INF Version section.

trans-unit.source: This setting is equivalent to specifying the Stampinf option -s section.
trans-unit.target: This setting is equivalent to specifying the Stampinf option -s section.

trans-unit.source: KMDF Version Number
trans-unit.target: KMDF Version Number

trans-unit.source: Specifies the version of KMDF that this driver depends on.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the version of KMDF that this driver depends on.

trans-unit.source: This is used to customize the KmdfLibraryVersion and KMDF co-installer name in the INF file.
trans-unit.target: This is used to customize the KmdfLibraryVersion and KMDF co-installer name in the INF file.

trans-unit.source: This option replaces the $KMDFVERSION$ and $KMDFCOINSTALLERVERSION$ keywords in the INF file.
trans-unit.target: This option replaces the $KMDFVERSION$ and $KMDFCOINSTALLERVERSION$ keywords in the INF file.

trans-unit.source: The string has the following format:
trans-unit.target: The string has the following format:

trans-unit.source: major_version>.<minor_version
trans-unit.target: major_version>.<minor_version

trans-unit.source: For example, if you specify 1.5 as the version string, the values 1.5 and 01005 are used for the two keywords (respectively).
trans-unit.target: For example, if you specify 1.5 as the version string, the values 1.5 and 01005 are used for the two keywords (respectively).

trans-unit.source: This setting is equivalent to specifying the Stampinf option -k KMDFversion.
trans-unit.target: This setting is equivalent to specifying the Stampinf option -k KMDFversion.

trans-unit.source: UMDF Version Number
trans-unit.target: UMDF Version Number

trans-unit.source: Specifies the version of UMDF that this driver depends on.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the version of UMDF that this driver depends on.

trans-unit.source: This option is used to specify the UmdfLibraryVersion and UMDF co-installer name in the INF file.
trans-unit.target: This option is used to specify the UmdfLibraryVersion and UMDF co-installer name in the INF file.

trans-unit.source: The version that is specified replaces the $UMDFVERSION$ and $UMDFCOINSTALLERVERSION$ keywords in the INF file.
trans-unit.target: The version that is specified replaces the $UMDFVERSION$ and $UMDFCOINSTALLERVERSION$ keywords in the INF file.

trans-unit.source: The version string has the following format:
trans-unit.target: The version string has the following format:

trans-unit.source: major_version>.<minor_version>.<service_version
trans-unit.target: major_version>.<minor_version>.<service_version

trans-unit.source: (where <service_version> is typically zero).
trans-unit.target: (where <service_version> is typically zero).

trans-unit.source: For example, if you specify 1.5.0 as the version string, the values 1.5.0 and 01005 are used for the major and minor keywords (respectively).
trans-unit.target: For example, if you specify 1.5.0 as the version string, the values 1.5.0 and 01005 are used for the major and minor keywords (respectively).

trans-unit.source: This setting is equivalent to specifying the Stampinf option -u UMDFversion.
trans-unit.target: This setting is equivalent to specifying the Stampinf option -u UMDFversion.

trans-unit.source: Catalog File Name
trans-unit.target: Catalog File Name

trans-unit.source: Specifies the value that is written in the CatalogFile directive in the INF Version section.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the value that is written in the CatalogFile directive in the INF Version section.

trans-unit.source: By default, the CatalogFile directive is not written.
trans-unit.target: By default, the CatalogFile directive is not written.

trans-unit.source: This setting is equivalent to specifying the Stampinf option -c catalogfile.
trans-unit.target: This setting is equivalent to specifying the Stampinf option -c catalogfile.

trans-unit.source: Verbose
trans-unit.target: Verbose

trans-unit.source: Shows verbose Stampinf output.
trans-unit.target: Shows verbose Stampinf output.

trans-unit.source: This setting is equivalent to specifying the Stampinf option -n .
trans-unit.target: This setting is equivalent to specifying the Stampinf option -n .

trans-unit.source: Version Header Path
trans-unit.target: Version Header Path

trans-unit.source: Specifies the location of Ntverp.h file.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the location of Ntverp.h file.

trans-unit.source: The path represent the fully qualified location of the directory containing Ntverp.h.
trans-unit.target: The path represent the fully qualified location of the directory containing Ntverp.h.

trans-unit.source: This setting is equivalent to specifying the Stampinf option -i path.
trans-unit.target: This setting is equivalent to specifying the Stampinf option -i path.

trans-unit.source: Related topics
trans-unit.target: Related topics
